tactile_feedback.description: Ensures the container is securely held during pouring.
examples: Feeling the handle of a pitcher remain steady
Preventing a slippery bottle from slipping out of hand

tactile_feedback.description: Sensation of the container tilting to control the flow of liquid.
examples: Feeling resistance as the pitcher tilts
Sensing the weight shift in a bottle

tactile_feedback.description: Detecting the weight of the liquid inside the container to estimate the remaining volume.
examples: Feeling a light pitcher as it empties
Sensing a heavy jug during initial pouring

tactile_feedback.description: Feeling the weight shift or balance change when the container is returned upright.
examples: Noticing the balance return when the bottle is set upright
Sensing the stop in flow from a tilted teapot

tactile_feedback.description: Feeling the texture of the container to maintain control and prevent slipping.
examples: Rough handle texture providing grip
Smooth glass bottle requiring firmer hold

tactile_feedback.description: Sensation of liquid shifting inside the container during tilting or movement.
examples: Feeling water slosh in a jug
Detecting syrup moving slowly in a bottle

tactile_feedback.description: Resistance experienced due to liquid viscosity during pouring.
examples: Sensing light resistance when pouring water
Feeling strong resistance when pouring honey

tactile_feedback.description: Sensation of liquid spilling or overflowing onto the hand or surface.
examples: Feeling liquid overflow onto fingers
Sensing drips down the side of a jug

tactile_feedback.description: Detecting the container's spout contact with the target to stabilize the flow.
examples: Feeling the jug spout rest against a funnel
Sensing the lip of a teapot touching a cup

tactile_feedback.description: Tactile cues from small vibrations or drips indicating flow irregularities.
examples: Feeling drips along the spout
Noticing slight vibrations as liquid exits
